alert.note: Alert for Pike (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 1:09PM EDT until July 09 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Pike. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 109 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Matamoras, Bushkill, Lackawaxen, Blooming Grove, Paupack, Shohola, Milford, Pecks Pond, Greeley, Dingmans Ferry, Greentown, Ledgerdale, Millrift, Lords Valley, Twin Lakes, Rowland, Promised Land State Park, Kimbles, Tamiment and Westcolang Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
